title: The best lawn care deals for Memorial Day 2023
description: Memorial Day is a great time to take advantage of deals on lawn care tools and equipment. Lowe's, Home Depot, Amazon, and other retailers are offering everything you need to make your lawn look its best.

title: The best robot mowers of 2023
description: Work smarter, not harder on your lawn this summer. The best robot mowers feature automatic scheduling and cut your grass for you.

title: Everything you need to host a Memorial Day party
description: Hosting a Memorial Day get-together this weekend? Here's what you need to kick off your party and the start of summer.

title: This new AI tool will summarize YouTube videos for you in seconds
description: The Eightify Chrome extension uses GPT technology to help you cut straight to the main points of any YouTube video.

title: The best riding mowers of 2023
description: With Memorial Day weekend ahead, up your summer lawn care with a riding mower that makes for a faster, more eco-friendly experience.

title: MacOS Network Locations is a handy feature you should be using
description: If you connect to different networks with your macOS device, you should take advantage of Network Locations for more flexibility and security.

title: Google ads will be customized for you using generative AI
description: Following a series of AI announcements made at Google I/O, Google continues adapting AI across its platforms.

title: Open-source AI holds a party in New York thanks to Stability.ai and Lightning.ai
description: Stability.ai founder Emad Mostaque and Lightning.ai CEO William Falcon made a pitch for defying tech giants' secrecy about AI source code.

title: Get your hands on this awesome Blackview power station for as little as $234
description: Yes, power stations are awesome, but they're also expensive. Well, here's a fantastic deal on the new Blackview Oscal PowerMax 700.

title: OpenAI could 'cease operating' in EU countries due to AI regulations
description: While AI experts call for AI regulations, OpenAI is considering exiting a continent that answered that call.

title: How to easily install a cloud service at home in an hour or less
description: Linux belongs on your home network, and setting up an on-premises cloud is simpler than you'd think.

title: How to use Wordtune AI to rewrite texts on your iPhone
description: This iOS app can generate simple messages and emails, photo captions, LinkedIn or Twitter posts, cover letters, blog posts, and more.

title: iOS 17 may introduce a useful iPhone smart display feature - and I have questions
description: The iPhone will reportedly turn into a smart display when locked, much like what Google and Amazon have done with tablets.

title: How to enable App Store notifications on MacOS to help keep your software up to date
description: If you want to make sure your MacOS software is always updated, and you should, enabling App Store notifications can help. Here's how.

title: Meet Aria: Opera's new built-in generative AI assistant
description: Move over, Edge. There's a new sidebar AI assistant in town.

title: What to do if Generative Fill is grayed out in your Adobe Photoshop AI beta
description: Adobe is heavily promoting its new Generative Fill AI feature, but for some folks there's nothing but disappointment. Here's how to enable the feature if it's grayed out on your computer.

title: Fitness isn't going to sell me on Apple's rumored Reality Pro headset
description: Reality Pro will need a killer feature to justify its rumored $3,000 price tag. For me, workouts and fitness apps aren’t it.

title: Abode launches new $160 Security Kit for your home
description: Abode's making it easier to add a basic but expandable security system to your home.

title: AI is coming to a business near you. But let's sort these problems first
description: ChatGPT-style AI tools that are limited to enterprise information are being considered. Here's what that technology could mean for you and your organization.

title: Singapore focuses ICT spend on cloud applications
description: More than SG$1 billion ($742.6 million) is up for grabs as the Singapore government earmarks 30% of its ICT budget for applications that will run on its commercial cloud infrastructure.
